\sphinxAtStartPar
This constitutes Deliverable 1.2.1.4.3.2.3 “End\sphinxhyphen{}User Interface Development Report”.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Background}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/background/index:background}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/background/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A beta version \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} was released in the Fall of 2021 to demonstrate the proposed functionality of the system. This version of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} was based on \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-0}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNode}} v3.3.2, with additional enhancements, including integration of an \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-API}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{API}} for ingestion of timeseries \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RTHS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RTHS}} data, a ‘Flood Wizard’ app for visualizing data and a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-H-H}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{H\&H}} model availability. After operating for 6 months, it was determined that installation on a single bare\sphinxhyphen{}metal server was insufficient for the anticipated  demand, and the base software suite upon which \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} was constructed, limited the implementation of Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery pathways for the already integrated extension and planned extensions \sphinxhyphen{} specifically those associated with \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-H-H}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{H\&H}} model execution.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the Spring of 2022, the beta site was decommissioned to allow for spin\sphinxhyphen{}up of a re\sphinxhyphen{}incarnation of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} addressing the key issues identified during beta deployment:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Migration from a single\sphinxhyphen{}stack \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Docker}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Docker}} container deployment, to a scalable \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Kubernetes}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Kubernetes}} cluster.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reliance on an inter\sphinxhyphen{}pod shared, cloud\sphinxhyphen{}based \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-NFS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{NFS}} volume service to ensure expansion and accomodation of the large volumes of geospatial data to be stored, and that produces by the integrated \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-H-H}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{H\&H}} and visualization tools.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reliance on a managed cloud\sphinxhyphen{}served database service, to ensure minimal data access bottle\sphinxhyphen{}necks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integration of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-0}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNode}} v4.0 to promote future growth and seamless conntinuous deployment.

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Development Infrastructure}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/index:development-infrastructure}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-CI-CD}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{CI/CD}} process relies on the following \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RATES}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RATES}} projects:


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabulary}{\linewidth}[t]{\X{1}{2}\X{1}{2}}
\hline

\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/spyce:module-spyce}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{spyce}}}}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} is a suite of tools designed to facilitate development and deployment of the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} ecosystem of services.
\\

&
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} is the host platform for \sphinxstyleemphasis{Wizards} and project documentation deployment.
\\

&
\sphinxAtStartPar

\\

\sphinxstepscope


\section{spyce}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/spyce:module-spyce}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/spyce:spyce}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/spyce::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!spyce@\spxentry{spyce}}\index{spyce@\spxentry{spyce}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} is a suite of tools designed to facilitate development and deployment of the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} ecosystem of services. Most operations related to development, deployment, maintenance, backup/restore, etc of the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-REON.cc}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REON.cc}} cyberinfrastructure are handled via the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RATES}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RATES}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} application. The \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Python}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Python}} codebase provides functionality through a series of \sphinxstyleemphasis{spells}  delivered via \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-CLI}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{CLI}} using the python \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fabric}} package. \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} provides a wide assortment of tools (\sphinxstyleemphasis{spells}), to simplify development, deployment and maintenance operations, ranging from generating project documentation and ingestion into the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} platform, creation and deletion of clusters, instantiation of specific apps on clusters, backup and restore, etc. Key to \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} operation is the reliance on environment variables to provide consistency between vendor/service provider toolchains.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{waterwizard}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/waterwizard:module-waterwizard}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/waterwizard:waterwizard}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/waterwizard::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!waterwizard@\spxentry{waterwizard}}\index{waterwizard@\spxentry{waterwizard}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} is the host platform for \sphinxstyleemphasis{Wizards} and project documentation deployment. It also serves as a loose template for deploying \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Django}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Django}} apps as a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Docker}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Docker}} stack, or as a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-K8s}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{k8s}} app. \sphinxstyleemphasis{Wizards}, such as \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Spyce}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Spyce}} \sphinxstyleemphasis{Wizard} are incorporated into the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Water-Wizard}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Water Wizard}} platform. Each \sphinxstyleemphasis{Wizard} is comprised of \sphinxstyleemphasis{Spells} that provide the desired functionality. \sphinxstyleemphasis{Flood Wizard} is a set tools designed to interact with flood forecasting tools to provide decision support and visualization functionality for the end user.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{geonodegcp}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/geonodegcp:module-geonodegcp}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/geonodegcp:geonodegcp}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/geonodegcp::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!geonodegcp@\spxentry{geonodegcp}}\index{geonodegcp@\spxentry{geonodegcp}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GeoNodeGCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNodeGCP}} is a migration pathway for convertig new releases of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-0}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNode}} for deployment on \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}}. It includes adaptations to \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}} such as reliance on \DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{CloudSQL} and \DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{FileStore} rather than generic, image\sphinxhyphen{}buit container services. Although \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GeoNodeGCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNodeGCP}} is specific for \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}} applications, it can be readily modified to work with any \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Kubernetes}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{kubernetes}} cyber\sphinxhyphen{}infrastructure.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{reonode}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reonode:module-reonode}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reonode:reonode}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reonode::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!reonode@\spxentry{reonode}}\index{reonode@\spxentry{reonode}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-REONode}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REONode}} serves as the development platform for \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-REON}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REON}} apps and extensions prior to release on \DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REONcc}. Because of the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-CI-CD}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{CI/CD}} nature of the end\sphinxhyphen{}user products such as \DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REONcc}, \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} and \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-SustainRGV}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{SustainRGV}}, a seperate development platform is used to ensure full seperation from operational databases and filesystems, prior to integration.

\sphinxstepscope


\section{reoncc}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reoncc:module-reoncc}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reoncc:reoncc}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/development/_autosummary/reoncc::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!reoncc@\spxentry{reoncc}}\index{reoncc@\spxentry{reoncc}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REONcc} os the reference implementation of tools and application developed to a stable status on \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-REONode}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REONode}}. It includes all data and tools relevant to water resources management, including hydrologic extremes and ecological resilience. :term”\sphinxtitleref{REONcc} serves as the host platform for \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-REON}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{REON}}.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Cloud Infrastructure}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:cloud-infrastructure}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} cloud deployment relies of conversion of it’s component services to be converted to be delivered via a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Microservices-Architecture}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Microservices Architecture}}. Several options are available for deploying the microservices version of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}}, including an on\sphinxhyphen{}premise hardware cluster, Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services and Microsoft’s Azure.


\section{Google Cloud Platform}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:google-cloud-platform}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Google Cloud Platfrom (\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}}) was selected as the initial platform for \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}}, based on Cost of Service, and integration with existing \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RATES}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RATES}} operations.


\section{Google App Engine}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:google-app-engine}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Google App Engine (\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GAE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GAE}}) allows users to deploy containerized apps on \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}}, whithout have to worry about underlying server management. Other than providing a cloud testing environment for individual microservices, \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GAE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GAE}} currently has limited utility for use in the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} ecosystem.


\section{Google Compute Engine}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:google-compute-engine}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Google} Compute Engine (\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCE}}) provides access to virtual machines (\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-VM}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{VM}}), and serves as the infrastructure basis for the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GAE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GAE}} environment. A \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCE}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-VM}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{VM}} was used to support the transition from a self\sphinxhyphen{}contained docker\sphinxhyphen{}stack to deploy a fully cloud\sphinxhyphen{}leverage \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} deployment.


\section{Google Kubernetes Engine}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:google-kubernetes-engine}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Google} Kubernetes Engine (\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GKE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GKE}}) provides the user access to the container orchestration facilities of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCP}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCP}}. Google’s Autopilot custer configuration was selected for cluster creation, allowing for ease of horizontal (node/cpu) and vertical (memory) scaling. As a result, cluster size is reported in terms of the number of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-vCPU}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{vCPU}} and memory rather than the traditional node count. Running the following applications to support continuous development:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
geonodegcp\sphinxhyphen{}app

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
reonode\sphinxhyphen{}app

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
waterwizard\sphinxhyphen{}app

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
rgvflood\sphinxhyphen{}app

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
with nominal use, the cluster scaled to 9.75 \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-vCPU}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{vCPU}} and 38.2 GB of memory. With one \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-vCPU}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{vCPU}} being roughly equivalent to one hardware core, this is similar in capacity to a single standard bare\sphinxhyphen{}metal server. With the integration of user\sphinxhyphen{}applications (e.g. RTHS Data API and Flood Wizard), along with anticipated end\sphinxhyphen{}user access and demand, horizontal scaling needs are expected to quadruple at a minimum.+


\section{CloudSQL}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:cloudsql}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Rather than rely on containerized database services, the decision was made to switch to Google CloudSQL managed database services. Similar services are available though \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-AWS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{AWS}} and \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Azure}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Azure}}. Unlike a single\sphinxhyphen{}stack \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Docker}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Docker}} deployment, switching to a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-K8s}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{K8s}} with potentialy multiple replicas needing to access the database services, reliance on managed database services eliminates the need to construct and manage a separate workload specically for database services.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The first step in transtioning to \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-K8s}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{k8s}} involved deploying the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{docker\sphinxhyphen{}compose.yml}} stack on a \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCE}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-VM}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{VM}}. The database service was then replaced with a CloudQSL\sphinxhyphen{}Proxy service, allowing the containers to access the databases managed by CloudDQL and permitting the number of replicas to be scale with no collisions or impacts in performance.


\section{Filestore}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/infrastructure/index:filestore}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Persistent file storage is handled differently between standard \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Docker}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Docker}} desktop deployments and scalable \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-K8s}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{K8s}} clusters. Implelementing persistent storage between reboots and between containers for the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-K8s}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{K8s}} deplyoment involved changing from volume mounts to and \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-NFS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{NFS}} share. This \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-NFS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{NFS}} share is also mounted by as \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-GCE}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GCE}} \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-VM}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{VM}} used during the development process for debugging. It is anticipated that the volume of filestorage needed will eventually be in excess of 1TB, more once real\sphinxhyphen{}time forecast data is produced.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Component Integrations}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index:component-integrations}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}} serves as the core platform into which value\sphinxhyphen{}added component services are plugged\sphinxhyphen{}in and provided for use by the end\sphinxhyphen{}user.


\section{RTHS Data API}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index:rths-data-api}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Originally packaged with the beta release of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}}, the RTHS Data \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-API}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{API}} ingests RTHS time\sphinxhyphen{}series data on\sphinxhyphen{}demand for use by the end\sphinxhyphen{}user. \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}} is also able to serve the data to other component services such as Flood Wizard, WRF\sphinxhyphen{}Hydro and the RAS Data Provider. The  RTHS Data API wil be included in the next release of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}}.


\section{Flood Wizard}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index:flood-wizard}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Flood Wizard is a Javascript Progressive Web Application developed using the Ionic framework. It was packaged with the last beta release of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}}, with the folliowing features:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ability to view and inspect the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}} delineated sub\sphinxhyphen{}basins and RTHS stations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ability to view and download the input data and modeling results from the Tier II modeling effots

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Overlay and compare stage height data from multiple RTHS stations

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Flood Wizard was deployed to seed end\sphinxhyphen{}user discussion on the type of applications deemed most useful by end\sphinxhyphen{}users. Flood Wizard will be  included in the next release of \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}}, incorporating user\sphinxhyphen{}recommended modifications and additions.


\section{RAS Data Provider}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index:ras-data-provider}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The goal of this component is to generate \DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{HEC RAS} input data for selected domains from \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} availalble data on demand.  At the very minimum, this will include discharge data extracted from hydrologic model outputs, along with pertinent RTHS data. Other data, such as topographic and hydraulic asset surveys will also be provided. The development of this component is currently on\sphinxhyphen{}going.


\section{WRF\sphinxhyphen{}Hydro}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/integrations/index:wrf-hydro}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Although not a direct integration, the outputs of the Tier I modeling effort will be ingested into \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} for visualization and decision support application.  Development of this component is pending prototype deployment of the Tier I model.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Conclusions}
\label{\detokenize{euidev/conclusions/index:conclusions}}\label{\detokenize{euidev/conclusions/index::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood.com}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood.com}} has been successfully taken out of beta and deployed in production mode.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The single\sphinxhyphen{}stack \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Docker}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Docker}} container deployment used in the beta deployment has been coverted to a scalable \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-Kubernetes}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{Kubernetes}} cluster.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The production system now relies on a shared inter\sphinxhyphen{}pod, cloud\sphinxhyphen{}based \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-NFS}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{NFS}} volume service, ensuring expansion and accomodation of the large volumes of geospatial data being stored, and produced by the \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-H-H}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{H\&H}} and visualization tools to be integrated.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Database services are now provided by a Google’s CloudSQL, a managed cloud\sphinxhyphen{}served database service, resulting in minimal data access bottle\sphinxhyphen{}necks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The core \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-0}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNode}} application has been upgraded to v4.0 maximizing the potential for future growth and seamless conntinuous deployment.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
A step\sphinxhyphen{}wise development process has been implemented, allowing both for the continuous integration of changes in third\sphinxhyphen{}party applications (e.g. \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-0}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{GeoNode}}), incorporation of new \sphinxhref{https://glossary.rgvflood.com/en/latest/glossary.html\#term-RGVFlood}{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{RGVFlood}} apps, rigorous testing and continuous deployment.

\end{enumerate}
